abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Thailand - EGAT
            Investment Program Support Project were as follows: the
            outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability was highly
            likely, the institutional development impact was High, and
            the Bank and borrower performance were both highly
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that complex
            projects could be formulated and approved within a short
            time frame when there is full cooperation between the Bank
            and the Borrower. The Bank's Partial Credit Guarantee
            could be a useful tool in securing favorable terms for the
            Borrower, provided it is selectively applied, i.e., when
            market conditions are appropriate and the Borrower's
            own credit rating is sound. Sudden economic/financial crisis
            in a country, especially following a prolonged period of
            growth, could severely impact power demand and void power
            development plans. Introduction of complex power pool
            operations in a developing country needs to be thought
            through with care. Active support rather than reluctant
            acquiescence of the utilities is necessary to push through a
            complex reform agenda.
